title: Effects of Kathy's deposit at First Federal Bank

content.description:
In answering the question, you should emphasize the line of reasoning that generated your results; it is not enough to list the results of your analysis. Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answer. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes.

Kathy deposits $10,000 cash into her checking account at First Federal Bank. The required reserve ratio is 20 percent.

Calculate the maximum possible change in First Federal’s loans as a result of Kathy’s deposit.

After all adjustments in the banking system have occurred, calculate the maximum possible change in each of the following as a result of Kathy’s deposit.

Demand deposits in the banking system

The money supply

Draw a correctly labeled graph of the money market and show the effect of Kathy’s deposit on the nominal interest rate.

Identify ONE reason that the change in the money supply could differ from the value calculated in part (b)(ii).
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

topic.text: 4.4: Banking and the Expansion of the Money Supply

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
